transcript.text: well shabbat shalom everyone is Friday
nights April 19th 2019 it is the 14th
day at even which means the 14th day of
the evening is about to go into the
fifteenth day which is the first day of
unleavened bread and Jeff and I are
gonna be getting ready to have our
Passover Seder here soon and we're also
joining with some people on zoom' the
prayer meeting and I just wanted to give
everyone just a little glimpse of our
Passover plates here we got the bitter
herbs parsley and some horseradish and
then we have the lamb and then we have
the matzo so matzo bitter herbs in the
lamb or what are commanded in Exodus 12
and then this is just something I like
to have is a traditional it's a Cara set
which is a apple of walnuts and and
brown sugar and it helps to offset the
bitterness of the the horseradish so
these are all very beautiful components
of the meal and of course we'll be
having some grape juice with this as
well and not this doesn't happen every
year but this year it just so happened
that the weekly Sabbath coincides with
with the Passover Seder and with the
beginning of the seven days of
unleavened bread
so the the first day of unleavened bread
and the seventh day of unleavened bread
they are always high Sabbath's no matter
you know what day of the week they fall
on but this first day of unleavened
bread falls on the weekly Sabbath so
it's kind of like a double Sabbath Oh
anyway I just wanted to give everyone
sort of a glimpse of what we're doing
tonight and I have a lot of teachings
about the Passover on my website at
spirit and tour comm if you want to
check those out but shabbat shalom
everyone and a happy Pesach Happy
Passover shabbat shalom I love ya
